metadata.title: CVE-2020-13765 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - medium
metadata.description:
rom_copy() in hw/core/loader.c in QEMU 4.0 and 4.1.0 does not validate therelationship between two addresses, which allows attackers to trigger aninvalid memory copy operation.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-13765` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

qemu-block-extra - 1:4.2-3ubuntu10
qemu-block-supplemental - 1:4.2-3ubuntu10
qemu-guest-agent - 1:4.2-3ubuntu10
qemu-system - 1:4.2-3ubuntu10
qemu-system-arm - 1:4.2-3ubuntu10
qemu-system-common - 1:4.2-3ubuntu10
qemu-system-data - 1:4.2-3ubuntu10
qemu-system-gui - 1:4.2-3ubuntu10
qemu-system-mips - 1:4.2-3ubuntu10
qemu-system-misc - 1:4.2-3ubuntu10
qemu-system-modules-opengl - 1:4.2-3ubuntu10
qemu-system-modules-spice - 1:4.2-3ubuntu10
qemu-system-ppc - 1:4.2-3ubuntu10
qemu-system-s390x - 1:4.2-3ubuntu10
qemu-system-sparc - 1:4.2-3ubuntu10
qemu-system-x86 - 1:4.2-3ubuntu10
qemu-system-x86-xen - 1:4.2-3ubuntu10
qemu-system-xen - 1:4.2-3ubuntu10
qemu-user - 1:4.2-3ubuntu10
qemu-user-binfmt - 1:4.2-3ubuntu10
qemu-user-static - 1:4.2-3ubuntu10
qemu-utils - 1:4.2-3ubuntu10
No subscription required

criterions.comment: qemu package in oracular, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:4.2-3ubuntu10').
